explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

flammable_liquids.rationale: Category 4 because of its flash point: 72degC

self_reactive_substances.rationale: This product including a ring with distortion (epoxides), and if this contacts metal salts etc., it is known to cause a very intense polymerization reaction. But there is no data, it cannot be classified.

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures, which in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: The chemical structure of the substance does not contain metals or metaloids(B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At).

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Organic compounds containing oxygen (but not chlorine and fluorine) chemically bonded only to carbon and hydrogen (but not to other elements).

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: It was set as Category 4 based on rat LD50 = 433mg/kg calculated from the three tests with rats (CERI Hazard Data (2002) and PATTY (5th, 2001)).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: It was set as Category 4 based on rabbit LD50= 1980mg/kg (ACGIH (2001), CERI Hazard Data (2002)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: The saturated vapor pressure concentration of this product is 1180ppm, and the 4 hour rat inhalation test (CERI Hazard Data (2002)) was conducted with steam. It was classified as Category 3 based on LC5 0= 580ppm based on the test.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Since there are discriptions of moderate irritation on rabbits (ACGIH (2001), PATTY (5th, 2001)), it was classified as Category 2.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Although there were severe irritation and corneal disorders to eye of rabbit, it is not irreversible damage (ACGIH (2001), PATTY (5th, 2001)). So it was set as Category 2A.

respiratory_skin_sensitizer.classification: Respiratory sensitization: Classification not possible; Skin sensitization: Classification not possible

germ_cell_mutagenicity.hazard_statement: Suspected of causing genetic defects (state route of exposure if it is conclusively proven that no other routes of exposure cause the hazard)
germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: The substance was classified as Category 2 by the guidelines. Based on the facts that there are positive results from the somatic cell in vivo mutagenicity tests (the in vivo micronucleus and chromosome aberration tests in mice and rats) (CERI Hazard Data (2002), ACGIH (2001), DFGOT vol.20 (2003), PATTY (5th, 2001)), and that there is no positive result from germ cell in vivo genotoxicity tests.

carcinogenicity.hazard_statement: May cause cancer (state route of exposure if it is conclusively proven that no other routes of exposure cause the hazard)
carcinogenicity.rationale: It was set as Category 1B based on being classified into 2A in IARC (IARC77 (2000)) and into 2A in Japan Society for Occupational Health (Japan Society for Occupational Health recommendation (2004)), and into 2 in EU (EU-Annex 1 (2005)).

toxic_to_reproduction.hazard_statement: Suspected of damaging fertility or the undorn child
toxic_to_reproduction.rationale: There is no description about the toxicity to parental animals. However, there are descriptios of testicular atrophy (DFGOT vol. 20 (2003, ACGIH (2001)), decreased fertility (CERI Hazard Data Description (2002)), resorption, death and growth inhibition of embryo and fetus (IARC 77 (2000), (CERI hazard data (2002)). Therefore, it was classified into Category 2.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: Cause damage to organs (central nervous system, respiratory)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: It is mentioned, "effects on the central nervous system are reported, and irritant properties to upper respiratory organs are shown" in humans (CERI Hazard Data (2002)). There are reports of irritation to lungs, pneumonia, pulmonary emphysema in animals (ACGIH (2001)), and the dosages required for the development of these disorders are not mentioned, but it is estimated that they developed at dosages around the LD50 values (1.36mg/L, 1.78mg/L) or less. Such doses are within the range of the guidance values for Category 1. The substance was classified as Category 1 (central nervous system, respiratory system) based on these results.

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs (central nervous system, liver, spleen) through prolonged or repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: In rat and mouse, at the dosage within the guidance value range of Category 2 (ten to 100 mg/kg), it was classified into Category 2 (central nervous systems, liver, spleen) based on the descriptions of encephalic nerves demyelination, fiblrillization of spleen, and the coagulative necrosis of liver (CERI Hazard Data (2002)).

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 3 from 96-hour EC50=53.3mg/L of algae (Selenastrum) (CERI Hazard Data, 2002).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since rapidly degrading (BOD: 85% (existing chemical safety inspections data)), and less bio-accumulative (log Kow=-0.95 (PHYSPROP Database, 2005)).
